channel.title: Incredibly slow download speeds/making bootable disk
channel.description: Im trying to download Ubuntu, and it is downloading at TOPS 30kbps. I did this test online, and it says i download at 232 kbps. What is going on, and how do i fix that? Also, how do i make a bootable Ubuntu disk, i tried already and it wouldnt work, like it would boot on start of the computer, and yes i went into the BIOS and changed it.

item.title: Incredibly slow download speeds/making bootable disk
item.dc:creator: @x0_0wn x0 0wn
item.description:
@x0_0wn wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:8, topic:157240”]Since no one has bothered to tell him, the speed provided at speedtest.net is in kilobits, NOT kilobytes. A kB(notice the uppercase b? this means it’s a kilobyte) is a kb times 8. So, say if your ISP offers you 2048kb(2mb) download speed, theoretically you could have 256kB download speed.

Since I assume you have 256kb broadband, your max download speed in kB is 32, and your downloading at 30.[/quote]

Yeah that’s me.

Read full topic
item.source: Incredibly slow download speeds/making bootable disk

item.title: Incredibly slow download speeds/making bootable disk
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Since no one has bothered to tell him, the speed provided at speedtest.net is in kilobits, NOT kilobytes. A kB(notice the uppercase b? this means it’s a kilobyte) is a kb times 8. So, say if your ISP offers you 2048kb(2mb) download speed, theoretically you could have 256kB download speed.

Since I assume you have 256kb broadband, your max download speed in kB is 32, and your downloading at 30.

Read full topic

item.title: Incredibly slow download speeds/making bootable disk
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Songoty:

I got Ubuntu, but it still is weird. I download at 30 kbps but it says on the speed test i download at 232 kbps. I also live in saskatoon. wich is in canada.

Like I said, 232 Kb/s = ~40 KB/s

Read full topic
item.source: Incredibly slow download speeds/making bootable disk

item.title: Incredibly slow download speeds/making bootable disk
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

The speed you download at is an 8th of your download speed.

256kb/ps = 32kb/ps download.

Read full topic

item.source: Incredibly slow download speeds/making bootable disk

item.title: Incredibly slow download speeds/making bootable disk
item.dc:creator: @Schizzo Schizzo
item.description:
@Schizzo wrote:

When downloading Ubuntu, there’s a lot of different locations that you can choose from. You have to choose the one that’s closest to where you live in order to get the best download speed. Try doing that.

If that doesn’t work then you could just order a live CD and wait.

[sub]Ubuntu isn’t all that great anyway.[/sub]

Read full topic
item.source: Incredibly slow download speeds/making bootable disk

item.title: Incredibly slow download speeds/making bootable disk
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

First, you probably mean you’re downloading at 30 KB/s, and the download test gave you 232 Kb/s, which would mean the test is accurate.

This is what I have…

About making it bootable, make sure you burn the .iso file with a legit burner.

Read full topic
